header: Faith in the Son of God

verse: Everyone who believes that Jesus is the ·Christ [Messiah] is ·God’s child [born of/begotten by God], and whoever loves the Father also loves the ·Father’s children [one born of/begotten by him].
·This is how [By/In this] we know we love God’s children: when we love God and ·obey [perform; carry out] his commands.
·Loving God means [For this is the love of God:] ·obeying [keeping] his commands. And God’s commands are not ·too hard [burdensome] for us [Matt. 11:30],
because everyone who is ·a child of [born of; begotten of] God ·conquers [defeats; overcomes] the world. And this is the ·victory [conquest] that ·conquers [defeats; overcomes] the world—our faith.
·So the one who conquers the world is [or Who is it that conquers/defeats/overcomes the world but…?] the person who believes that Jesus is the Son of God.

Jesus Christ is the One who came by water [likely a reference to Jesus’ baptism] and blood [a reference to his death]. He did not come by water only, but by water and blood. And the Spirit ·says that this is true [is the one who testifies/bears witness; Mark 1:11; John 1:32–34], because the Spirit is the truth.
·So [or For] there are three ·witnesses [who testify/bear witness]:
the Spirit, the water, and the blood; and these three witnesses ·agree [are one].

·We believe people when they say something is true. But what God says is more important [If we accept the witness/testimony of people, the witness/testimony of God is better], ·and he has told us the truth about his own Son [because this is the witness/testimony God has given about his Son].

Anyone who believes in the Son of God ·has the truth that God told us [or has the internal testimony of the Holy Spirit; or has the testimony of the eyewitnesses (see 1:1–4); has the witness/testimony in himself]. Anyone who does not believe makes God a liar [1:10], because that person does not believe ·what God told us [the witness/testimony that God witnessed/testified to] about his Son.
This is ·what God told us [the witness/testimony]: God has given us eternal life, and this life is in his Son.
Whoever has the Son has life, but whoever does not have the Son of God does not have life.
·I write this letter [I have written these things] to you who believe in the [name of the] Son of God so you will know you have eternal life.
And this is the ·boldness [confidence] we have ·in God’s presence [before God; 3:21]: that if we ask God for anything ·that agrees with what he wants [according to his will], he hears us.
[And] If we know he hears us ·every time we ask him [in whatever we ask], we know we have what we ask from him [3:21–22; Mark 11:24].

If anyone sees a brother or sister [fellow believer] sinning (sin that does not lead to ·eternal death [death]), that person should ·pray [ask; intercede], and God will give the sinner life. I am talking about people whose sin does not lead to ·eternal death [death]. There is ·sin [or a sin] that leads to [eternal] death [probably referring to the false teachers, their rejection of the Spirit’s work having put them beyond repentance; compare Mark 3:29]. I do not mean that a person should ·pray [ask; intercede] about that sin.
·Doing wrong is always sin [All unrighteousness is sin], but there is sin that does not lead to ·eternal death [death].

We know that those who ·are God’s children [are born of/begotten by God] do not ·continue to sin [sin; 3:6, 9]. The ·Son of God [the one born of/begotten by God; Jesus] ·keeps them safe [protects them], and the Evil One [the Devil] cannot ·touch [harm] them.
We know that we ·belong to God [or are children of God; are of God], but the Evil One controls the whole world.

We also know that the Son of God has come and has given us understanding so that we can know the True One. And ·our lives [we] are in the True One and in his Son, Jesus Christ. He is the true God and the eternal life.
So, dear children [2:1], ·keep yourselves away [guard yourselves] from ·false gods [idols; either literal idols or false ideas about God].
